78c8ca06-0bca-4c97-868d-e7d3fea452c2.description: The earner completed Alabama's Certified Public Manager (CPM) Program facilitated by Auburn University at Montgomery. The CPM Program is a comprehensive training program that develops and strengthens the leadership and management skills of public sector managers through experiential learning using course material, individual and team projects, and developmental exercises. The CPM program is conducted in two segments: CPM I (Associate Level Certification) followed by CPM II (Full Certification).

alignments.name: National Consortium of Certified Public Managers
alignments.description: The earner demonstrated the following competencies established by the National Consortium of Certified Public Managers: Managing Work, Leading People, Personal and Organizational Integrity, Developing People, Change Leadership, Systemic Integration, and Public Service Leadership.

alignments.name: Alabama Society of Certified Public Managers
alignments.description: The earner qualifies for membership in the Alabama Society of Certified Public Managers (ASCPM), where they may benefit from networking opportunities and continuing education, while qualifying for leadership roles in the local society.

alignments.name: Graduate Elective Credits toward Master of Public Administration Degree
alignments.description: The CPM designation is equivalent to six graduate electives in Auburn University at Montgomery's (AUM's) Master of Public Administration program. AUM's MPA Program prepares students for management positions in the nonprofit sector and various administrative and management opportunities in local, state, or national government.

alignments.name: Graduate Elective Credits toward Master of Business Administration Degree
alignments.description: The CPM designation is equivalent to six graduate electives in Auburn University at Montgomery's (AUM's) Master of Business Administration program. AUM's MBA Program prepares students with fundamental management knowledge in preparation for management and leadership positions across various industries.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner was selected into the CPM Program by their immediate supervisor or other organizational leaders. A formal essay was submitted and approved prior to admittance into the program.

The earner completed a minimum of 300 contact hours of leadership and management coursework, focused on topics such as Leadership, Managing Projects, Building Teams, Innovation, Presentation Skills, Interpersonal Communication, Performance Coaching, Effective Writing, Change Management, Proposing Data Driven Recommendations and more. Assessments such as the Myers Briggs Type Indicator, Strengthsfinder, and DiSC are integrated throughout the program to strengthen leadership competence.
The earner was evaluated on the successful completion of written reflective papers on 32 course topics, demonstrating writing skills, course competence and leadership application to the workplace.

During the Associate Level of the CPM Program (CPM I), the earner successfully initiated and completed the design and planning phase of a project that created an efficiency gain and cost savings for their organization. The project was evaluated by CPM instructors and the participant's organizational leaders.

During the Associate Level of the CPM Program (CPM I), the earner presented project findings and recommendations to class colleagues and organizational leaders through a formal presentation evaluated by instructors, class members, and instructors. A written project report was also produced and evaluated.

During the Advanced Level of the CPM Program (CPM II), the earner completed the nationally acclaimed capstone project, Solutions Alabama, where they collaborated in teams to offer data driven recommendations to citizens and state leaders across Alabama. Teams published white papers and provided a public presentation in order to celebrate statewide successes, raise awareness and offer solutions to key issues.
The earner completed an additional 30 contact hours of training related to their career training and personal development.
